document.topic_text: Search Plans to seal ‘assault’ doorway 0 Have your say Plans have been drawn up to stop people sleeping rough in a doorway where a Doncaster homeless man was attacked. Karl Notley was left in a coma after suffering serious injuries as he spent the night in the doorway of the British Heart Foundation Shop on Printing Office Street in Doncaster town centre. Now planning notices outside the building reveal proposals to seal the space off with a metal barrier which would keep rough sleepers out. An official report beforeDoncaster Council town planning officers states that the recessed entrance has been subject to antisocial... read more Sheffield Telegraph , 17 March 2013 in Yorkshire & Humber Man arrested for assault after police cordon off blood stained doorway 0 Have your say A man has been arrested on suspicion of assault after an incident which led to a police cordon in Doncaster town centre this morning. Video: Blood stained Doncaster doorway sealed off by police Police say the site had been the scene of... Doncaster Free Press , 10 August 2016 in Yorkshire & Humber Concerns for homeless man seriously injured in Doncaster town centre doorway assault 0 Have your say A homeless man was taken to hospital with serious head injuries after he was attacked in Doncaster town centre. The man, named locally as ‘Carl’, was taken to Doncaster Royal Infirmary after the incident, which happened in the early... Doncaster Free Press , 11 August 2016 in Yorkshire & Humber Concerns for homeless man seriously injured in Doncaster town centre doorway assault 1 Have your say A homeless man was taken to hospital with serious head injuries after he was attacked in Doncaster town centre. The man, named locally as ‘Carl’, was taken to Doncaster Royal Infirmary after the incident, which happened in the early... South Yorkshire Times , 11 August 2016 in Yorkshire & Humber
